question: 手
sourceAnswer: hand/arm | forepaw/foreleg | handle | hand/worker/help | trouble/care/effort | means/way/trick/move/technique/workmanship | hand/handwriting | kind/type/sort | one's-hands/one's-possession | ability-to-cope | hand-(of-cards) | direction | move-(in-go,-shogi,-etc.)
sourceMnemonic: The kanji means <kanji>hand</kanji>, and the word means <vocabulary>hand</vocabulary> too! It can also be used to refer to your whole <vocabulary>arm</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it uses the kun'yomi reading. Since this is a body part, the kun'yomi reading usually takes priority. That means you learned the kun'yomi reading already when you learned the kanji.
